=== Road Map ===
==== Current Developments ====
* Translate Lucid Lynx to Russian
* Test Lucid Lynx
==== Mid- and Long-term targets ====
* Create Ubuntu Russian Remix
* Make new designs for Russian Ubuntu resources
* Integrate resources into portal as single entry point for people looking for information about Ubuntu in Russian
==== Ongoing activities ====
* Provide support by any means feasible on-line (forum, jabber, irc; one of ideas currently in development: pool of people able to provide on-line support directly) as well as off-line (e.g. gather information where interested people can get a disc with distribution) to Russian-speaking users
* Spread word about FOSS in general and Ubuntu in particular (good example: translation of FullCircle)
* Involve more people in real-life activities: extend geography of our non-virtual presence

==== Translations ====

===== Russian Ubuntu Translators =====
* Home: https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-l10n-ru
* 78 members, about 1000 various contributors
* Ubuntu translation stats for 2 past releases and upcoming Lucid:
** 9.04: 78% translated, 10th in list
** 9.10: 75% translated, 10th in list
** 10.04: 72% translated, 11th in list
* Accepts feedback from users via e-mail: translation-bugs@ubuntu.ru
* Uses bug tracker: https://bugs.launchpad.net/~ubuntu-l10n-ru

==== Resources ====

===== ubuntu.ru =====

* <nowiki>[[http://ubuntu.ru/|A good starting point]]</nowiki> to join Ubuntu community and investigate what Ubuntu is
* Official <nowiki>[[http://ubuntu.ru/news|Ubuntu news]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://ubuntu.ru/calendar|events calendar]]</nowiki> and more
* About 400'000 page views from 200'000 visitors monthly

===== forum.ubuntu.ru =====

* <nowiki>[[http://forum.ubuntu.ru/|Our forum]]</nowiki> is the best resource on Ubuntu in Russian providing support for users
* 60'000 registered users, almost 690'000 messages in 72'000 threads
* Constant growth of popularity: 3'000'000 views from 970'000 visitors in March, 2010

===== help.ubuntu.ru =====

* <nowiki>[[http://help.ubuntu.ru/|Consolidated wiki in Russian]]</nowiki> with user's documentation. Currently there are about 400 pages, but there is a lot of new contributors joining the effort lately 
* <nowiki>[[http://help.ubuntu.ru/manual|Russian Ubuntu guide for beginners]]</nowiki>. There is also project at Launchpad providing a PDF-version of the guide at https://launchpad.net/ubuntu-russian-guide
* More than 75'000 visitors with about 220'000 page views last month

===== PR =====

* <nowiki>[[http://ubuntu.ru/rup|Russian Ubuntu Podcast]]</nowiki> launched and became one of the most popular russian podcasts on <nowiki>[[http://rpod.ru/|Russian Podcating portal]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[http://ubuntu.ru/fullcircle|Full Circle Russian edition]]</nowiki> is now recognized as valueable source of information on Ubuntu. Among translation of original materials it includes special Russian section with interviews and information on Russian Ubuntu resources.
* Spreading information about Ubuntu, Community and LoCo activity at the Russian *nix portals, popular social networks and blogs.
